title: How did the earlier scientists and their contributions directly affect the discoveries of the later scientists? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are the central “scientists” of modern science - but all they presented are theories that have no actual scientific proof and are essentially supported only by argument. Charles Darwin had a scientific education of his day, medical. In reaction to the death of his little daughter, he said that there could not be a Good God, and eliminated God from any place in his scientific world. The Bible Creation was rejected. His Theory of Evolution is the result of his rejection of God. After near 150 years, Evolution is yet unproven, no intermediate species have been found. Darwin’s Theory of Evolution depends its time theory on James Hutton and Charles Lyell's Uniformitarianism (both only argued theories). James Hutton's “Theory of the Earth” (1785), proposed geological findings as being based on “long periods of time”. Charles Lyell was reacting to William Buckland of Oxford, and his Noah's Flood “Catastrophism”. Lyell denied All Catastrophes and his “Steady State” Uniformity theory (Uniformitarianism) says that there is little change over time in the geology and life of the earth, that changes occurred only by the same slow-moving forces in existence today, acting over a very long periods of time. While the denial of catastrophes was the central theme of Lyell’s Uniformity, it has more recently been mostly rejected, the science has been forced to accept the concept of catastrophic events, with drastic changes resulting. All that is left is the “Steady State Uniformity” of “long periods of time” - which is expanded to “millions of years” and even into the billions. Scientific findings have made by later scientists, who then make an effort to fit these into some form of this theory. Huge pictures have been built, and the school systems teach the future scientists of this as “Truth”. All discoveries since have been forced to fit into these two theories. Previous discoveries are argued and acclaimed as being proofs - Instead of actual scientific proof of the connection, the statement so often heard is “It just HAS to be …..” Any discovery that would oppose features of this theory are rejected, or argued and forgotten. Scientists who do not accept the theories, regularly lose their job. Upcoming students know that their acceptance of these theories directly affects their future. There are actual challenges to this “scientific” theory, they are ignored and refused. Science continues to promote “Evolutionary Truth”.

Earlier quantum physicist theorys, discoveries and findings were the stepping stones to later discoverys. Einstein's early acheivements were a result of the prior works of Max Planck, who had built upon his predecessors. Our current level of knowledge mostly follow this same pattern. This still does not mean 'all physicists theorys or ideas’ are always correct, remember unless the entire quantum buliding blocks way I've mentioned here 'falls apart’ - Einstien was wrong about 'dice play’ and Niels Bohr was right. (No hidden variables.) Often modern day physicists do not view older paradigms in ways which allow them to be true but can still 'transend’ there limits letting those discoveries stand on their own 'laurels’ which are often times 'bendable’ This is a HUGE mistake.
